intro: Spergularia munbyana, commonly known as Munby's sandspurry, is a low-growing flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern England. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in dunes and coastal grasslands. It is adapted to harsh maritime conditions, including salt spray and strong winds. Spergularia munbyana plays a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
